channel.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
channel.description:
I'm hosting a minecraft server for the community now, and it's quite good and popular. Join it at minecraft.moparisthebest.com, more details here:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,479610.0.html

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:67, topic:377092”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=473006.msg3520479#msg3520479 date=1299366931]
I use screen also, but I’ve no idea how to make sure the server goes off cleanly, would you mind posting what you use? I can’t find the script in mineos.
[/quote]Isn’t it just the save-all and stop console commands?[/quote]
aha, screen -X “stuff ‘stop\012’”

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:67, topic:377092”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=473006.msg3520479#msg3520479 date=1299366931]
I use screen also, but I’ve no idea how to make sure the server goes off cleanly, would you mind posting what you use? I can’t find the script in mineos.
[/quote]Isn’t it just the save-all and stop console commands?[/quote]

there’s no need to save-all if you use stop

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:65, topic:377092”]I use screen also, but I’ve no idea how to make sure the server goes off cleanly, would you mind posting what you use? I can’t find the script in mineos.[/quote]Isn’t it just the save-all and stop console commands?

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s the admin.sh in the mineos release, mine is too heavily modified to be of use to anyone else.

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I use screen also, but I’ve no idea how to make sure the server goes off cleanly, would you mind posting what you use? I can’t find the script in mineos.

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Yes, I use screen. I basically ripped the script from mineos and made quite a few changes from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Can I ask how you save & gracefully stopped the server and make sure it has done both? (Did you use screen?)

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Sod’s law.

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Good old corrupted map! And the day after I went from backing up every hour to every 24 hours, so we lost 22 hours… Needless to say, I’ve went back to backing up every hour.

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

We found the culprit, hopefully it wont happen again…

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

Lmfao lol

Read full topic

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:56, topic:377092”]The problem with a restarter like that, is if you just plain old kill the server, players inventories are sometimes not saved and get cleared when the server goes back up.

EDIT: My server also does this a LOT-

[quote]2011-03-03 17:03:30 [SEVERE] java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
2011-03-03 17:03:30 [SEVERE] Unexpected exception
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
2011-03-03 17:03:52 [SEVERE] Exception in thread “Thread-6”
2011-03-03 17:04:02 [SEVERE] java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
2011-03-03 17:04:02 [SEVERE] Exception in thread “Connection #70 read thread”
2011-03-03 17:04:33 [SEVERE] java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
2011-03-03 17:04:53 [SEVERE] Exception in thread “Connection #62 read thread”
2011-03-03 17:05:53 [SEVERE] Exception in thread “Connection #86 read thread” Excep
2011-03-03 17:07:22 [SEVERE] tion in thread “Connection #75 read thread” Exception in thread "Connection #85 read thrException in thread "Connection #85 read thr
[/quote][/quote]

I gracefully stop and start the server every 6 hours, so nothing should be lost. Of course if the process isn’t responding I have to kill it, no choice there.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:52, topic:377092”]Yes he does! I actually have to run a cronjob to restart this bad boy every 6 hours because it stops accepting connections, but continues to run, here is a small portion of a log filled with this (from running for about 10 hours straight, I don’t know exactly when this started)

item.title: Join the official MineCraft server!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:48, topic:377092”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=473006.msg3516844#msg3516844 date=1299056800]

Why don’t you just do what every other server is doing and go vanilla till the mod API comes out.

Everyone thinks when bukkit comes out it’ll be wonderful, but as soon as the API comes out, bukkit is useless.
[/quote]This is true, not to mention the modder community is really really REALLY behind, as they could easily make their hacks auto-update.

You are preaching to the choir here Speljohan, they don’t seem interested in it at all though:
http://forums.bukkit.org/threads/where-is-my-bukkit-preview.543/page-2#post-9441[/quote]Yes, it is a shame really. To think that they would prefer hackish unreliable solutions requiring a significiant time-investment over simple, clean and tidy ones!

Read full topic
